snippet: A new federal rule requires disclosures on what fees 401(k)’s are being charged by administrators, bookkeepers, fund managers and other middlemen.
abstract: New Labor Department rule requires disclosures on what fees 401(k)s are being charged by administrators, bookkeepers, fund managers and other middlemen; window has been opened on these expenses which were previously difficult to figure out, hopefully preventing fees and expenses depleting a retiree's nest egg.
lead_paragraph: A new federal rule requires disclosures on what fees 401(k)’s are being charged by administrators, bookkeepers, fund managers and other middlemen.

headline.seo: How to Cut Expenses From Your 401(k)
